page.title: 08CHIPPERFIELD FIELD-PATH WALK
page.content: Leave Scatterdells Lane by Jungle Path climb two stiles, right into remains of green road -thick tall hedges of hazel,holly,hawthorn,bramble,bryony & wild clematis.A short stretch and out into the expanse of a western prairie- sudden change to high skies & distant view.Miles of thickset hedgerows and spinney bulldozed away in last ten years.Now ten-furrow ploughs turn up hand-sized pieces of flint and pudding stone.Path used by locals exercising dogs.No traffic but incessant aircraft noise _light planes from Elstree and Leavesden, larger from Luton flying to holiday resorts, largest circling round in Bovingdon stack,awaiting turn on flight path to Heathrow. Prettiest are hot-air balloons drifting silently in quiet summer skies.
